newsitem.title: CANADA: Imperial Oil faces cut from Toronto index.
newsitem.headline: Imperial Oil faces cut from Toronto index.

text.p: The Toronto Stock Exchange said on Thursday that Imperial Oil Ltd failed to meet inclusion criteria for the Toronto 35 index of stocks based on year-end 1996 statistics.
To be eligible for the index of the exchange's largest issues, a stock must rank in the TSE 300 composite index's top 125 in volume traded, value traded and transactions executed.
The TSE said Imperial, Canada's biggest energy company, ranked 138th in volume of shares traded last year.

The TSE said that if any Toronto 35 company failed to meet all inclusion criteria December 31, they would be removed from the index on the same day as expiry of the February 1997 Toronto 35 Index options and futures contracts.
The exchange's index committee was scheduled to meet early this month to decide on a replacement stock for the index. ((-- Reuters Calgary Bureau (403) 531-1624))
